content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM offers reimbursements for certain moving and other relocation expenses on a case by case basis. Portions of any relocation reimbursement expenses, whether paid directly to you or indirectly to the third party vendor, are considered taxable income by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). These relocation reimbursements must be reported on your W-2 for tax purposes and the IRS requires that tax be withheld from the reimbursement. EPAM reports reimbursement expenses on your W-2 when the expenses are paid, not when you incur the relocation expense. EPAM reserves the right, in its sole and absolute discretion, to modify the foregoing or discontinue providing reimbursement for relocation expenses and/or making payments to the IRS for income taxes on relocation expenses without providing notice.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Income Tax Payment for Certain Relocation Expenses\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"text-decoration\":\"underline\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"In certain circumstances EPAM may, in its sole and exclusive discretion, agree to assist you in paying a portion of the taxes associated with the reimbursement of your non-deductible relocation expenses. It is not the intent of EPAM to make you \\\"whole\\\" or pay your entire tax liability associated with the reimbursement of relocation expenses.\\nEPAM may remit a maximum payment to the IRS for income taxes on relocation expenses equal to the lesser of (i) $7,000 of relocation expenses incurred during first thirty (30) days from the initial date of relocation or (ii) Non Deductible Expenses (as defined below) incurred in first thirty (30) days from the initial date of relocation. EPAM's assistance with taxes on the reimbursement of your non-deductible moving relocation expenses will be computed as follows:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"20% Federal Income Tax (subject to changes when specified by the IRS);\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"6.2% Social Security (up to an annual income cap for the year); and\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"1.45% Medicare\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Please note that any relocation expenses reimbursed by EPAM, including relocationg expenses that exceed the amounts that EPAM has agreed to pay a portion of the associatated income tax, will be included as compensation in your W-2.\\nThe income tax payment paid by EPAM to the IRS on your behalf only applies to employees that relocate within the U.S. or permanently to the United States from another country.\\nAny relocation expenses reimbursed by EPAM or any associated income taxes paid by EPAM to the IRS on yoru behalf will be included in the Year-to-Date (YTD) totals on your paycheck. EPAM does not assist with state or local (city, town and county) taxes assessed on relocation expenses reimbursed by EPAM.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Non-Deductible Expenses (Taxable Expenses)\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"text-decoration\":\"underline\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Reimbursement or direct payment of any of the following relocation expenses are considered gross income for Federal Income Tax and FICA (Social Security) tax purposes and will be reported on your W-2. These expenses are \\\"nondeductible\\\" for Federal Income Tax purposes. Non-deductible moving expenses include, but are not limited to:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Rental car usage during temporary housing\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Return home visits\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Temporary housing in new location\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Relocation Cash Allowance\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Other incidental move expenses such as Rental Assistance, etc.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Settlement or acquisition of a lease (lease termination)\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"All meals\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The following relocation expenses are not considered gross income for Federal Income Tax purposes and FICA tax purposes and will not be reported on your W-2. EPAM will not assist with income taxes on the following expenses:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Transportation of household goods and storage of household goods during the first thirty (30) days from the date of relocation.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Reasonable travel expenses incurred one day prior to your departure through the day of your arrival in your new location (this does not include meals and a portion of any mileage expense).\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If you have any questions or concerns regarding the above form, please contact Olga Bobina to discuss.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"FAQs\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"text-decoration\":\"underline\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"- This Relocation Tax Memo relates specifically to relocations within or to the United States.\\n- The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) is a United States federal governmental agency that is responsible for the collection of both corporate and individual taxes.\\n- A W-2 is a statement of your earnings during the preceding year and will be the source of the information needed to complete your yearly tax return.\\n- Each employee in the United States receives a W-2 on January 31st of each year.\\n- Income taxes paid on your behalf by EPAM will be remitted directly to the IRS.\\n- Reimbursement expenses will be reported on your year end W-2.\\n- An individual's tax obligation will vary based on circumstances unique to the individual.\\n- For more detailed information regarding taxation of relocation expenses, please refer to IRS Publication 521.\\n- If you have any questions regarding your income tax obligations you will need to contact a tax professional for assistance with your tax return.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"I understand that EPAM expects me to comply with these rules. I also understand that EPAM is not a party to any tax position taken by me on my individual tax return for any year.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\n\\n\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}}"
